pre_Gross_Motor_Skills1.fieldName: Can walk independently with good balance

pre_Gross_Motor_Skills2.fieldName: Can kick a ball forward without falling

pre_Gross_Motor_Skills3.fieldName: Can walk up and down stairs without assistance

pre_Gross_Motor_Skills4.fieldName: Can hop forward on one foot without support

pre_Gross_Motor_Skills5.fieldName: Can throw a ball and hit a target with a dominant hand

pre_Fine_motor_Skills1.fieldName: Can remove forms from a form board or inset puzzle like shapes or animals etc

pre_Fine_motor_Skills2.fieldName: Can scribble linear and/or circular patterns spontaneously.

pre_Fine_motor_Skills3.fieldName: Can use pads of fingertips to grasp pencil or tripod grip.

pre_Fine_motor_Skills5.fieldName: Can hold paper with one hand while drawing or writing with other hand.

pre_Fine_motor_Skills6.fieldName: Can draw a person with 4 or more parts

pre_Fine_motor_Skills7.fieldName: Can cut with scissors, following a line.

pre_Fine_motor_Skills8.fieldName: Can imitate vertical and horizontal markings

pre_Self_help1.fieldName: Can use spoon or fork for eating solid food

pre_Self_help2.fieldName: Can drink from a cup without assistance (little SPILLING is okay)

pre_Self_help3.fieldName: Can undo atleast two of these - large buttons, snaps, shoes laces, zipper,velcro etc

pre_Self_help5.fieldName: Can put on shoes (even if he or she put on the wrong foot)

pre_Self_help6.fieldName: Can express need to use the toilet

pre_Self_help7.fieldName: Can control his or her bowel movements

pre_Self_help9.fieldName: Can take care of toileting needs (i.e undressing, cleaning, and dressing)

pre_Self_help10.fieldName: Can manipulates large buttons, velcro, zippers independently

pre_Social_Emotional1.fieldName: Can identify self as boy or a girl

pre_Social_Emotional3.fieldName: Can imitate or help in simple house hold tasks

pre_Social_Emotional5.fieldName: Can name his or her friends

pre_Social_Emotional6.fieldName: Can understand rules of simple games when playing with adults or peers

pre_Social_Emotional7.fieldName: Can waits for his turn for adults or teachers attention

pre_Social_Emotional8.fieldName: Can describe his or her feelings i.e says I am sad or happy or mad

pre_Social_Emotional9.fieldName: Can recognize the feelings of others

pre_Social_Emotional10.fieldName: Can show responsibility and admits errors or wrong doing i.e says sorry when made a mistake

pre_Cognitive1.fieldName: Can point to atleast twenty things or pictures when they are named.

pre_Cognitive2.fieldName: Can show interest and enjoyment in age appropriate books and printed material?

pre_Cognitive3.fieldName: Can match colors or point correctly to atleast two colors.

pre_Cognitive4.fieldName: Can say size words like large/big or little/small correctly?

pre_Cognitive5.fieldName: Can dress up and play/act pretending to be someone else?

pre_Cognitive7.fieldName: Can know the difference between living and nonliving things.

pre_Cognitive8.fieldName: Can attend to a learning task /story in a small group for 5 minutes.

pre_Cognitive9.fieldName: Can follow two or more step directions or instructions

pre_Cognitive10.fieldName: Can answer simple logical questions like ' What do we eat'?

pre_Cognitive11.fieldName: Can say alphabets or letter names by rote?

pre_Communication1.fieldName: Can identify his or her own body parts like nose, eyes, ears

pre_Communication2.fieldName: Can look at or point to objects across the room when it is named

pre_Communication4.fieldName: Can say two or three words sentences.

pre_Communication5.fieldName: Can correctly use words like me, I, Mine or You

pre_Communication6.fieldName: Can respond to who or what questions e.g 'who gives us milk' or 'what do you do with a pen'

pre_Communication7.fieldName: Can tell his or her first and last name

pre_Communication8.fieldName: Can use pronouns like I, you and me

pre_Communication9.fieldName: Can respond with yes or no appropriately

pre_Communication10.fieldName: Can ask questions that begin with who and where

pre_Communication11.fieldName: Can answer WH questions - what, who, when, where, why, and how

pre_Communication13.fieldName: Can recall events from a story presented orally

pre_Communication14.fieldName: Can communicate his or her experiences clearly enough for other to understand

pre_Communication15.fieldName: Can recognize a printing of his or her first and last names

pre_Communication16.fieldName: Can read a simple story aloud so that someone who is only listening can follow the story

pre_Communication17.fieldName: Can engage in a meaningful conversations with adults or peers

pre_Communication18.fieldName: Can describe what is happening in a picture

pre_Behaviors1.fieldName: Inappropriate movements like fidgeting, walking and running excessively

pre_Behaviors2.fieldName: Inappropriate vocalizations like talking out, excessive crying or teasing or jargon speech

pre_Behaviors3.fieldName: Repetive body movements like rocking, toe walking, spinning etc

pre_Behaviors5.fieldName: Self absorbed or does not relate to other adults or children

pre_Behaviors6.fieldName: Difficulty transitioning from one activity to another
